gmd:hierarchyLevelName.gco:CharacterString: Highest level of data collection, from a common set of sensors or instrumentation, usually within the same research project

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - Trace Element Profiles from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Trace element profiles from GT-10 and GT-11 Dataset Description: <p>Trace metal profile data for two stations (7 and 9) during the US GEOTRACES North Atlantic zonal transect in 2010 (GT-10) and for three super stations (10, 12 and 20) during the US GEOTRACES North Atlantic zonal transect in 2011 (GT-11).</p><p>Version 2015-02-04: revised sample numbers&nbsp;for KN204, sta.10, cast 1, depths 40, 65 84, 96 from&nbsp;&nbsp;6890, 6892, 6894, and 6896 to&nbsp;&nbsp;6790, 6792, 6794, and 6796.<br />Version 2013-01-10: original version</p> Acquisition Description: <p>Samples were collected with the US GEOTRACES clean rosette sampling system. Samples were filtered through 0.2 micrometer pore size Acropak capsule filters. Samples were stored in 0.5 L conventional polyethylene bottles acidified with 2 mL of 6 N Q-HCl to a pH of ~1.7.</p><p>In the lab at UCSC the samples were extracted off-line in an 8-channel manifold extraction system using Nobias PA-1 chelating resin (Biller and Bruland, 2012) with a slight modification of adding fluoride ion to the sample and HF to the eluant Q-nitric acid (Middag et al., in prep).<br />&nbsp;</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0961579 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0961579

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Ocean Sciences Department University of California 1156 High Street

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sta', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31968.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sta', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'cast'; this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: sample date, UTC; General Description: UTC month, day and year, usually as a text string, e.g. feb10_1995. It is better to use one of the other forms of presenting date and time data so that the data can be used in computations and for comparisons. Note, if the string begins with numbers but also includes letters, there may be problems using the field name for retrieval. Use date_gmt for future data sets.

PI-supplied Description: latitude; north is positive; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: longitude; east is positive; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: nominal sample depth; General Description: depth; nominal

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; rangies from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sample'; this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: bottle identification; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Yttrium in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Yttrium subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Cadmium in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Lanthanum subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Lead in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Iron in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Iron subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Nickel in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Nickel subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Zinc subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Gallium in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Gallium subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Cobalt in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Cobalt subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: average concentration of Copper in sample; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: standard deviation of Copper subsample concentration; General Description: Standard deviation reported for the concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element and units.

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g., NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>Samples were collected with the US GEOTRACES clean rosette sampling system. Samples were filtered through 0.2 micrometer pore size Acropak capsule filters. Samples were stored in 0.5 L conventional polyethylene bottles acidified with 2 mL of 6 N Q-HCl to a pH of ~1.7.</p><p>In the lab at UCSC the samples were extracted off-line in an 8-channel manifold extraction system using Nobias PA-1 chelating resin (Biller and Bruland, 2012) with a slight modification of adding fluoride ion to the sample and HF to the eluant Q-nitric acid (Middag et al., in prep).<br />&nbsp;</p>

<p>Sample concentrations were determined on a weight basis. Data for dissolved Y, Cd, La, Pb, Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Cu, Zn and Ga are presented in concentrations units of pmol/kg (Y, Cd, La, Pb, Ga) or nmol/kg (Mn, Fe, Ni, Cu, Zn).<br />UV oxidization of the samples prior to extraction was necessary for dissolved Co and Cu. Samples were analyzed with and without prior treatment by UV oxidation. Only the UV-treated sample data should be used for dissolved Co and Cu. For the other trace elements, all the data was averaged.</p><p>On the GEOTRACES 2011 cruise (Stations 10, 12 and 20), some sporadic contamination of Cu, Zn and Ni was observed. The contamination problem for Cu was the worst and it occurred at roughly a constant ratio of Cu:Ni:Zn. Samples with obvious Cu contamination were eliminated from the Corrected UV data sets. Samples that were obviously significantly contaminated for Cu also showed significant Zn and Ni contamination and were eliminated from the corrected Zn and Ni average data sets.</p><p>Data for the SAFe and GEOTRACES Reference Samples are included with each data set submitted along with blanks and detection limits.</p><p><strong>Related references:</strong></p><p>Cutter, G.A. and K.W. Bruland. Rapid and non-contaminating sampling system for trace elements in global ocean surveys. Limnology and Oceanography: Methods, 10: 425-436 (2012).<br /><br />Biller, D.V. and K.W. Bruland. Analysis of Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Cu, Zn, Cd, and Pb in seawater using the Nobias-chelate PA1 resin and magnetic sector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. Marine Chemistry, 130/131: 12-20 (2012).</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong>&nbsp; After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.</p><p>A standardized BCO-DMO method (called join) was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.</p><p>If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the name of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.</p><p>See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: CTD profiler Instrument Name: CTD profiler Instrument Short Name:CTD Instrument Description: The Conductivity, Temperature, Depth (CTD) unit is an integrated instrument package designed to measure the conductivity, temperature, and pressure (depth) of the water column. The instrument is lowered via cable through the water column and permits scientists observe the physical properties in real time via a conducting cable connecting the CTD to a deck unit and computer on the ship. The CTD is often configured with additional optional sensors including fluorometers, transmissometers and/or radiometers. It is often combined with a Rosette of water sampling bottles (e.g. Niskin, GO-FLO) for collecting discrete water samples during the cast. This instrument designation is used when specific make and model are not known. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/130/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Teflon TM Instrument Description: GO-FLO Teflon-lined Trace Metal free sampling bottles are used for collecting water samples for trace metal, nutrient and pigment analysis. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is designed specifically to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: GeoFish Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:XR High Resolution Magnetic SectorICP-MS Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:Mass Spec Instrument Description: General term for instruments used to measure the mass-to-charge ratio of ions; generally used to find the composition of a sample by generating a mass spectrum representing the masses of sample components. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
